org.unc.lac.baboon.config

Class BaboonConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.unc.lac.baboon.config.BaboonConfig

  • public class BaboonConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Configuration Class. This class allows to import a json file containing the Topic objects description of the system.

    Also, this class contains the method for subscribing HappeningController and TaskController annotated methods (and the instance of the object supposed to run this methods) to a Topic

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ariel Ivan Rabinovich, Juan Jose Arce Giacobbe

      • getHappeningController

        public HappeningControllerSubscription getHappeningController(org.javatuples.Pair<java.lang.Object,java.lang.reflect.Method> key)
        Returns the HappeningControllerSubscription mapped to key on happeningControllerSubscriptionsMap
        Parameters:
        key - a Pair of an Object and a Method annotated with HappeningController whose associated HappeningControllerSubscription is to be returned.
        Returns:
        a HappeningControllerSubscription to which the specified key is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the key.

      • getHappeningControllerCount

        public int getHappeningControllerCount()
        This method returns the number of HappeningControllerSubscription objects that are mapped to a key on happeningControllerSubscriptionsMap
        Returns:
        the number of HappeningControllerSubscription objects that are mapped to a key on happeningControllerSubscriptionsMap

        This method returns a Collection containing all the SimpleTaskControllerSubscription subscriptions registered in this BaboonConfig.
        Returns:
        a Collection containing all the SimpleTaskControllerSubscription subscriptions registered in this BaboonConfig.

      • getComplexSecuentialTask

        public ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription getComplexSecuentialTask(java.lang.String name)
        Returns the ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription mapped to name on complexTaskMap
        Parameters:
        name - A name given by user on the creation of a new ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription, by using createNewComplexTaskController(String, String)
        Returns:
        a ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription to which the specified name is mapped, or null if this map contains no mapping for the name.

      • addTopics

        public void addTopics(java.lang.String topicsJsonFilePath)
               throws BadTopicsJsonFormat,
                      NoTopicsJsonFileException
        Imports the configuration of Topic objects described on the file provided.
        Parameters:
        topicsJsonFilePath - the path of the json file containing the topics configuration.
        Throws:
        BadTopicsJsonFormat - If the topic file provided is badly formed.
        NoTopicsJsonFileException - If the topic file provided does not exist.
        See Also:
        TopicsJsonParser

      • getTopicByName

        public Topic getTopicByName(java.lang.String topicName)
        Returns the Topic with the name provided or null if there's no topic with such name.
        Parameters:
        topicName - The name of the topic to be returned
        Returns:
        The Topic with the name provided as parameter

      • subscribeControllerToTopic

        public void subscribeControllerToTopic(java.lang.String topicName,
                                       java.lang.Object object,
                                       java.lang.String methodName,
                                       java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                throws NotSubscribableException
        Subscribes an object instance, a method and the arguments of this method to one topic. The method to be subscribed must be annotated with HappeningController or TaskController. A HappeningControllerSubscription or SimpleTaskControllerSubscription is created.
        Parameters:
        topicName - The name of the topic to be used for the subscription
        object - The object instance to subscribe on a new TaskActionController or HappeningActionController as ActionController.actionObject
        methodName - The name of the method to subscribe on a new TaskActionController or HappeningActionController as ActionController.actionMethod
        parameters -
        • The parameters to be used as arguments of the method on the new TaskActionController or HappeningActionController. This parameters are used along with the methodName to resolve the right method to use.
        • When registering a HappeningActionController parameters will be used only to determine the method, since the execution of HappeningController annotated methods is triggered by user software but synchronized by Baboon framework. In this case, mock instances of the classes required by the method could be used, allowing the framework to resolve and subscribe the method.
        Throws:
        NotSubscribableException -
        • If the topicName provided as argument is null
        • When a topic with name topicName does not exist
        • If there is more than one permission on Topic.permission
        • If the object provided as argument is null
        • If the methodName provided as argument is null
        • If the framework fails to resolve the method
        • If there is a SecurityException when trying to resolve the method
        • If an exception is thrown on ActionController.resolveGuardProviderMethods()
        • If the method is not annotated with HappeningController or TaskController
        • When trying to subscribe a HappeningActionController that is already subscribed
        • When trying to subscribe a TaskActionController to a Topic with empty Topic.permission
        • If the permission transition name is an empty String for a SimpleTaskControllerSubscription
        • If the permission transition name is null for a SimpleTaskControllerSubscription
        • If there are guard callbacks on the topic and Topic.setGuardCallback and Topic.permission sizes are different.
        • If the ActionController.actionObject does not have a GuardProvider annotated method to handle a guard declared in the topic
        See Also:
        Topic, ActionController, TaskActionController, HappeningActionController, SimpleTaskControllerSubscription, ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription

      • subscribeStaticControllerToTopic

        public void subscribeStaticControllerToTopic(java.lang.String topicName,
                                             java.lang.Class<?> methodsClass,
                                             java.lang.String methodName,
                                             java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                      throws NotSubscribableException
        Subscribes a static method and the arguments of this method to one topic. The method to be subscribed must be annotated with HappeningController or TaskController. A HappeningControllerSubscription or SimpleTaskControllerSubscription is created.
        Parameters:
        topicName - The name of the topic to be used for the subscription
        methodsClass - The class on which the method is defined
        methodName - The name of the static method to subscribe on a new TaskActionController or HappeningActionController as ActionController.actionMethod
        parameters -
        • The parameters to be used as arguments of the method on the new TaskActionController or HappeningActionController. This parameters are used along with the methodName to resolve the right method to use.
        • When registering a HappeningActionController parameters will be used only to determine the method, since the execution of HappeningController annotated methods is triggered by user software but synchronized by Baboon framework. In this case, mock instances of the classes required by the method could be used, allowing the framework to resolve and subscribe the method.
        Throws:
        NotSubscribableException -
        • If the topicName provided as argument is null
        • When a topic with name topicName does not exist
        • If there is more than one permission on Topic.permission
        • If the methodsClass provided as argument is null
        • If the methodName provided as argument is null
        • If the framework fails to resolve the method
        • If the method resolved is not static
        • If there is a SecurityException when trying to resolve the method
        • If there's an exception on ActionController.resolveGuardProviderMethods()
        • If the method is not annotated with HappeningController or TaskController
        • When trying to subscribe a HappeningActionController that is already subscribed
        • When trying to subscribe a TaskActionController to a Topic with empty Topic.permission
        • If the permission transition name is an empty String for a SimpleTaskControllerSubscription
        • If the permission transition name is null for a SimpleTaskControllerSubscription
        • If there are guard callbacks on the topic and Topic.setGuardCallback and Topic.permission sizes are different.
        • If the ActionController.actionObject does not have a GuardProvider annotated method to handle a guard declared in the topic
        See Also:
        Topic, ActionController, TaskActionController, HappeningActionController, SimpleTaskControllerSubscription, ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription

      • createNewComplexTaskController

        public void createNewComplexTaskController(java.lang.String complexTaskName,
                                           java.lang.String topicName)
                                    throws NotSubscribableException
        Creates a new ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription
        Parameters:
        complexTaskName - A name to identify this complex taskController. This name must be unique.
        topicName - The name of the topic to be used for the subscription
        Throws:
        NotSubscribableException -
        • If complexTaskName is empty String
        • If complexTaskName is null
        • If complexTaskName is already registered
        • If topicName is empty String
        • When a topic with name topicName does not exist
        • When the Topic has an empty Topic.permission
        • If there are guard callbacks on the topic and Topic.setGuardCallback and Topic.permission sizes are different.
        See Also:
        Topic, ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription, TaskActionController

      • appendControllerToComplexTaskController

        public void appendControllerToComplexTaskController(java.lang.String complexTaskName,
                                                    java.lang.Object object,
                                                    java.lang.String methodName,
                                                    java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                             throws NotSubscribableException
        This method requires an object instance, a method and the arguments of this method to append a new TaskActionController to the ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription identified by complexTaskName. The method to be subscribed must be annotated with TaskController.
        Parameters:
        complexTaskName - The name that identifies the complex taskController, it is provided on createNewComplexTaskController(String, String) when creating the taskController.
        object - The object instance to be subscribed on a new TaskActionController as ActionController.actionObject.
        methodName - The name of the method to be subscribed on a new TaskActionController as ActionController.actionMethod.
        parameters - The parameters to be used as arguments of the method on the new TaskActionController. This parameters are used along with the methodName to resolve the right method to use.
        Throws:
        NotSubscribableException -
        • If the object provided as argument is null
        • If the methodName provided as argument is null
        • If complexTaskName is empty String
        • If complexTaskName is null
        • If the framework fails to resolve the method
        • If there is a SecurityException when trying to resolve the method
        • If there's an exception on ActionController.resolveGuardProviderMethods()
        • If the method is not annotated with TaskController
        • If the TaskActionController object does not have a GuardProvider annotated method to handle a guard declared in the topic
        • If the Topic object have less permissions than the number of TaskActionController objects in ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription
        • If the topic permission corresponding to this taskController is empty
        • If the topic permission corresponding to this taskController is null
        • If fails to append the TaskActionController to ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription.

      • appendStaticControllerToComplexTaskController

        public void appendStaticControllerToComplexTaskController(java.lang.String complexTaskName,
                                                          java.lang.Class<?> methodsClass,
                                                          java.lang.String methodName,
                                                          java.lang.Object... parameters)
                                                   throws NotSubscribableException
        This method requires a static method and the arguments of this method to append a new TaskActionController to the ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription identified by complexTaskName. The method to be subscribed must be annotated with TaskController.
        Parameters:
        complexTaskName - The name that identifies the complex taskController, it is provided on createNewComplexTaskController(String, String) when creating the taskController.
        methodsClass - The class on which the method is defined
        methodName - The name of the static method to be subscribed on a new TaskActionController as ActionController.actionMethod.
        parameters - The parameters to be used as arguments of the method on the new TaskActionController. This parameters are used along with the methodName to resolve the right method to use.
        Throws:
        NotSubscribableException -
        • If the methodsClass provided as argument is null
        • If the methodName provided as argument is null
        • If complexTaskName is empty String
        • If complexTaskName is null
        • If the framework fails to resolve the method
        • If the the method is not static
        • If there is a SecurityException when trying to resolve the method
        • If an exception is thrown on ActionController.resolveGuardProviderMethods()
        • If the method is not annotated with TaskController
        • If the TaskActionController object does not have a GuardProvider annotated method to handle a guard declared in the topic
        • If the Topic object have less permissions than the number of TaskActionController objects in ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription
        • If the topic permission corresponding to this taskController is empty
        • If the topic permission corresponding to this taskController is null
        • If fails to append the TaskActionController to ComplexSecuentialTaskControllerSubscription.
